sourceText: Listen to them, look at them. Give them your full attention. Have fun!
text: Listen to them, look at them. Give them your full attention. Have fun!

sourceText: Read a book or look at pictures.
text: Read a book or look at pictures.

sourceText: Make drawings with crayons or pencils.
text: Make drawings with crayons or pencils.

sourceText: Dance to music or sing songs!
text: Dance to music or sing songs!

sourceText: Do a chore together –  make cleaning and cooking a game!
text: Do a chore together –  make cleaning and cooking a game!

sourceText: Help with school work.
text: Help with school work.

sourceText: Ideas with your young child.
text: Ideas with your young child.

sourceText: Switch off the TV and phone. This is virus-free time.
text: Switch off the TV and phone. This is virus-free time.

sourceText: Talk about something they like: sports, music, celebrities, friends.
text: Talk about something they like: sports, music, celebrities, friends.

sourceText: Cook a favourite meal together.
text: Cook a favourite meal together.

sourceText: Exercise together to their favorite music.
text: Exercise together to their favorite music.

sourceText: Ideas with your teenager.
text: Ideas with your teenager.

sourceText: Copy their facial expression and sounds.
text: Copy their facial expression and sounds.

sourceText: Sing songs, make music with pots and spoons.
text: Sing songs, make music with pots and spoons.

sourceText: Stack cups or blocks.
text: Stack cups or blocks.

sourceText: Tell a story, read a book, or share pictures.
text: Tell a story, read a book, or share pictures.

sourceText: Ideas with your baby/toddler.
text: Ideas with your baby/toddler.

sourceText: Choosing builds their self confidence.
text: Choosing builds their self confidence.

sourceText: If they want to do something that isn’t OK with physical distancing, then this is a chance to talk with them about this. (see next leaflet)
text: If they want to do something that isn’t OK with physical distancing, then this is a chance to talk with them about this. (see next leaflet)

sourceText: Ask your child what they would like to do.
text: Ask your child what they would like to do.

sourceText: It can be for just 20 minutes, or longer – it’s up to us.
text: It can be for just 20 minutes, or longer – it’s up to us.

sourceText: It can be at the same time each day so children or teenagers can look forward to it.
text: It can be at the same time each day so children or teenagers can look forward to it.

sourceText: Set aside time to spend with each child.
text: Set aside time to spend with each child.

sourceText: We can also see this as a chance to make better relationships with our children and teenagers.
text: We can also see this as a chance to make better relationships with our children and teenagers.

sourceText: One-on-One time is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important.
text: One-on-One time is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important.

sourceText: Can’t go to work? Schools closed? Worried about money?
text: Can’t go to work? Schools closed? Worried about money?

sourceText: It is normal to feel stressed and overwhelmed.
text: It is normal to feel stressed and overwhelmed.
